title: What songs did George Harrison write for the Beatles? - Quora

response.answer_text: The list of songs George Harrison is credited as a co-writer during the Beatles' years (all by himself, unless co-writers are given) in rough chronological order: "In Spite of All the Danger" (Anthology 1) (McCartney-Harrison)"Cry For a Shadow" (Anthology 1) (Lennon-Harrison)"Don't Bother Me" (With the Beatles)"You Know What to Do" (Anthology 1)"I Need You" (Help!)"You Like Me Too Much" (Help!)"Think For Yourself" (Rubber Soul)"If I Needed Someone" (Rubber Soul)"12-Bar Original" (Anthology 2) (Lennon-McCartney-Harrison-Starr)"Taxman" (Revolver)"Love You To" (Revolver)"I Want to Tell You" (Revolver)"Within You Without You" (Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band)"Flying" (Magical Mystery Tour) (Lennon-McCartney-Harrison-Starr)"Blue Jay Way" (Magical Mystery Tour)"The Inner Light" (Past Masters 2)"While My Guitar Gently Weeps" (The Beatles, a.k.a The White Album)"Piggies" (The Beatles, a.k.a. The White Album)"Long Long Long" (The Beatles, a.k.a. The White Album)"Savoy Truffle" (The Beatles, a.k.a. The White Album)“Los Paranoias” (Anthology 3) (Lennon-McCartney-Harrison-Starr) "Not Guilty" (Anthology 3)"Sour Milk Sea" (rejected for the White Album, recorded by Jackie Lomax)"Circles" (rejected for the the White Album, exists in demo form, re-recorded by Harrison for the "Gone Troppo" album)"Dehra Dun" (rejected for the White Album, Harrison reveals that he wrote the song in the "Anthology" video)"Only a Northern Song" (Yellow Submarine)"It's All Too Much" (Yellow Submarine)"Old Brown Shoe" (Past Masters 2)"Badge" (Clapton-Harrison) (recorded by Cream; Harrison is credited as L'Angelo Mysterioso and plays rhythm guitar on it)"Something" (Abbey Road)"Here Comes the Sun" (Abbey Road)"All Things Must Pass" (Anthology 3)"For You Blue" (Let It Be)"I Me Mine" (Let It Be)"Dig It" (Let It Be) (Lennon-McCartney-Harrison-Starr)"Maggie May" (Let It Be) (Traditional adaptation by Lennon-McCartney-Harrison-Starr)"Free As a Bird" (Anthology 1) (Beatles' version by Lennon-McCartney-Harrison-Starr)"Christmastime (Is Here Again)" ("Free As a Bird" single) (Lennon-McCartney-Harrison-Starr) Also, Lennon and McCartney helped Harrison with some of the earlier compositions but were not credited. My apologies if I missed one or two. I did not include the songs from George's 1967 album "Wonderwall Music" or his 1969 album "Electronic Sound" because they were solo albums and not many people have actually heard them. On September 22, 2014, they were re-released both separately and as part of a box set called "The Apple Years 1968-1975").

Something is probably his most memorable but to list them all off the top of my head would be tough. Don't Bother Me George wrote while in hospital and not feeling well and just wanted to be left alone!! Piggies from the White album which his mom gave him the line " what they need's a damn good whacking ". Savoy Truffle was written by him aimed at Eric Claptons love for candies. Good News was a brand of candy. Yes, you'll have to have them all pulled out after the Savoy Truffle! Lol. The Inner Light was George's. I think it was originally only on the B side of the Lady Madonna 45. Indian influence! Old Brown shoe was his also. Of course Taxman was a brilliant and slightly controversial song by George about the British high taxes. There's one for you, nineteen for me! Lol. I want to tell you is his also. You like me too much is George's too. I need you from HELPis his. Of course, While my guitar gently weeps. Here comes the sun was written by George in Eric Claptons back yard in the early morning! And my personal favorite " Within you, Without you, from Sgt. Pepper. The lyrics just blow me away. I might have missed a few but I'm working by mostly memory. Of course George wrote many songs for the Beatles that were voted out, but toward the end he had compiled a lot of good stuff which landed on the All Things Must Pass album set which kicked ass on the other 3 Beatles first solo releases!! I hope I helped you guys! Peace. OM.
